Articles.Content:
<p><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_ne6l47Qnde1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> This week, I moved from the Editor Gizmos, which are mostly complete now (pending QA and all that) to another major goal for this update, upgradeable facilities. The Content Team has been hard at work for months already producing assets for all the facilities in their various levels. My part in this is to make sure the assets are set up properly to spawn at KSC, and to write the code that will make it all work in game. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve written a set of new controllers which work very similarly to the code that runs and keeps track of the Destructible Facilities. On scene start, KSC spawns at its place on KerbinÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s surface, which brings in Upgradeable Facility objects. These look for data from the save file to spawn the correct model for each facility. These models then have yet another set of controllers which load either the intact or destroyed version of destructible objects in each facility. It took some brainbashing, but I managed to put together a system which works well with all these daisy-chained spawning objects, allowing us to have persistent, upgradeable, destructible Facilities at the space center.</span></p>

<p><span>One interesting thing we had to find a way to work through here, were the bits of the space center which arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t part of any facility. These are the filler ground sections between buildings, and the crawlerway leading to the launchpad. These objects arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t upgradeable by themselves, but they too have to change as KSC evolves around them. For that, we have a second type of upgradeable object which instead of being upgradeable manually or from saved data, they update their state based on the state of one or more neighboring upgradeables. That means the ground sections between facilities can automatically upgrade themselves to better match the level of the areas they connect. </span></p>

<p><span>Up next for this week (and the weekend, and likely the week after that too) is to continue setting up each level of each facility here, plus its wrecked version, plus its demolition FX and sounds. Needless to say, this is a gigantic amount of work, but here is where our decision to do destructible buildings on the last update is really paying off. We already have the workflow, the infrastructure and the tools to take on this much larger job without getting tangled in a mess of unorganized assets and incomplete code.</span></p>

<p><span>The facility assets are still being developed though, so while those are still being built, my focus is going to be on setting up the gameplay systems which will interact with upgradeable facilities. First up are the UIs to actually perform the upgrades, then hooking the system up to require Currencies to afford upgrading, and finally the code to allow other components to query the upgrade level of facilities and change behavior based on those levels.</span></p>

<p><span>All in all, a proper mountain of work lies ahead, so I better stop writing now and get back to it.</span><strong><strong><br/></strong></strong></p>

<p><span><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA):</strong> </span><span>As every week, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m doing database backups and server monitoring. However, this week we received a couple of KerbalEdu license validation issues, so weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re checking that itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s working as it should.</span></p>

<p><strong>Mike (Mu):</strong><span> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been plowing on with the experience system and the various UI tweaks needed to support it. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve also developed a new tooltip controller system for use in all the areas which currently use their own tooltip system. It will help us consolidate all our tooltips into one easy-to-use interface.</span></p>

<p><strong>Marco (Samssonart): </strong><span>This week I got to work with mister Romfarer, he did a few nice looking GUI elements I needed for the building description markers, which by the way are coming along quite nicely. They should be ready to undergo QA in the next few days.</span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been wrapping up the assets for the Upgradeable Buildings thing with Nick and Roger. After working three months modeling and texturing in Maya, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s time to move to Unity and start tweaking the assets. I have been talking with Felipe all week on the proper way of handling the prefabs inside the system he built for the buildings. I can, for certain, say that we are on 80% development of the assets, and 50% of the feature. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s going to be an interesting development week, since there are things that need to be optimized, like modular parts and props and shaders. On the other hand, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m writing that dev blog post I promised two dev notes ago. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m on page two and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s nearly the introduction, so expect lots of information, visual aids and a description for each building when it is time for you to roam into our asset creation pipeline for the last three months! </span></p>

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> This week i have been working on the main controller for the new partlist toolbar which is part of the editor overhauls for 0.26. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s basically hundreds of code lines flipping buttons on and off. </span></p>

<p><span>As you recall, the editor part list previously had 7 tabs. We are replacing these with a filter called Ã¢â‚¬Å“FunctionÃ¢â‚¬Â which holds all of the previous tabs except subassemblies. And we are also planning on splitting the propulsion tab into fuel and engines. So if you donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t select another filter, the editor will work just like it did before.</span></p>

<p><span>In addition to Ã¢â‚¬Å“FunctionÃ¢â‚¬Â we are planning to add more ways to list parts up, all with their own subcategories. For example. Ã¢â‚¬Å“by moduleÃ¢â‚¬Â, Ã¢â‚¬Å“by manufacturerÃ¢â‚¬Â, Ã¢â‚¬Å“by resource containedÃ¢â‚¬Â etc. And the funky thing is you can select both filter by Ã¢â‚¬Å“FunctionÃ¢â‚¬Â and any of the other filters. So you can for example find utility parts made by strutco.</span></p>

<p><span>To get a bit more technical: before the tabs were pretty much hardcoded into the part-list system and split by the Ã¢â‚¬Å“categoryÃ¢â‚¬Â field in part.cfg. We are now replacing this with an exclusion filter system that works as a combined predicate list on AvailableParts. The idea behind that change is to eventually make part-listing moddable.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Max (Maxmaps):</strong> .</span><span>IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been coordinating the completion of the new biomes with our awesome contributor, as well as organizing the team as we push to get the update out as soon as possible. Have also sat down to plan some of the smaller elements of Multiplayer implementation, but thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a long ways away still.</span></p>

<p><strong>Ted (Ted):</strong><span> It is time! We have begun the last cycle of Alpha QA (that’s rather exciting to say!). The lucky feature to get first dibs on Branch Testing is Kerbal Experience. For the moment we’re performing just playtesting on it and getting a feel for the feature from multiple perspectives. It’s such a core gameplay feature that it will require /a lot/ of feedback and tweaking, so getting started early is very good.</span></p>

<p><span>We’ve also done a couple of builds using Unity 4.5.5, which is looking promising in stability (it’s not worse!), and all platforms are doing well on it so far (though it is early days). Even the Windows player focus issue that prevented us from updating to 4.5.3 across platforms for 0.25 is all fixed.</span></p>

<p><span>Additionally, the Kerbal Experience feature seeing QA has been a good chance to see how the Bug Tracker Wiki holds up with feature documentation and it’s holding up very well, the formatting is especially clean and tidy.</span></p>

<p><span>Lastly, I’ve been working with Alex on a couple of additions/improvements to the Bug Tracker for us to use and making previous versions of KSP available internally for regression testing.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong>Your #KSPumpkin contest entries are coming along very well. If you’ve got something in the works, make sure to post it <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97765-The-Official-KSPumpkin-Halloween-Contest-Thread"><strong>HERE</strong></a> or on Twitter with the hashtag #KSPumpkin before November 1st if you want to win. If you miss out, though, we’ve got a neat contest with Shapeways in November and we’ve also got something else cooking for December. We’re getting pretty contest happy. I like it. I hope you do, too.<br/></span></p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-79130e57-5965-74d8-85b3-5c53d925ba8f"><br/><span>Rogelio (Roger):</span></strong> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been finishing the missing upgradable buildings and by “finishing” I mean there were a lot of missing textures and models to dress up the whole environment. These last 3 months have been very hard, since there were a lot of assets to model, but Dan is finally putting together all the things weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been doing and it is looking really nice. Now that weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re almost done with the 3d modeling and painting textures stuff, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re going to set the material into unity. ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the tricky part for me, since IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m not really an expert with unity tools. I’ll find the way to make them work somehow.</p>

good beans:)

also first

After last week's riot over the proposed D&D experience system I was hoping for more details on how they planned to change it, rather than, "We're mushing on through, it's going to QA."

Edited October 29, 2014 by Franklin

Can you confirm whether the runway and launch-pad will be a bit less prone to exploding when a heavy craft launches or lands? Might not be an important at the stage of introducing destructible/upgradeable buildings, but then again it might be critical!
should have called this the "NASA let Jeb fly" edition
Upgradable buildings? New part categorization system? .90 is looking great!

It is nice to see things going on as planned.

@HarvesteR could you mention more details on the editor gizmos you made?
MK3 parks and Kerbal Experience aren't getting sidelined again I hope. Those are the features I'm most looking forward to.
Aerodynamics news?

You're talking about upgrading buildings, and the upgrades change how the buildings work. I find myself thinking of Dwarf Fortress-like levels of complexity to manage the entire Kerbal industry. I'm sure you're not going for that kind of detail... but it could be really cool!

Will the upgrade system be as moddable as the rest of the game so far?

Aerodynamics news?

I don't they'll work on it until after 0.90 is released, given the previous dev notes

You're talking about upgrading buildings, and the upgrades change how the buildings work. I find myself thinking of Dwarf Fortress-like levels of complexity to manage the entire Kerbal industry. I'm sure you're not going for that kind of detail... but it could be really cool!

Will the upgrade system be as moddable as the rest of the game so far?

So that means I'll be able to change my title to something useless relevant to this game?

I'm really excited about part filters. I have barely dug into IR, KAS, Interstellar or IPL because I can never figure out which parts go with which mod. Hopefully a mod is created early that can organize parts by what folder they are in in the GameData folder, or some other way of sorting by mods.

So that means I'll be able to change my title to something useless relevant to this game?

I'm really excited about part filters. I have barely dug into IR, KAS, Interstellar or IPL because I can never figure out which parts go with which mod. Hopefully a mod is created early that can organize parts by what folder they are in in the GameData folder, or some other way of sorting by mods.

Already made

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/62466-0-25-Simple-Part-Organizer-v1-2-1

Can't wait to see what these upgradeable buildings will add to gameplay. I'm thinking some type of part gating...

I am hoping they become the new tech tree. Upgrade a building, unlock some parts.

Excited for the new editor features and, as well, not-so-patiently waiting on the new Mk3 parts. As for Kerbal EXP, the community seems to hate the idea of KSP-RPG, so I really don't see it becoming much of anything of use. I think I'll be stuck playing sandbox, as career inches further from my liking with each update.

Still, I love this game and the dev's continued support of the modding community allows me to play the game I want, and I appreciate that.
Another excellent update. Lots of details about what's happening and the progress.

The way I see it, Kerbal Experience should modify the Kerbals and their mission more than the craft they fly. Using a less stupid Kerbal? Then you'll get a higher science return! Using a more stupid but more courageous Kerbal? Your science return will be lower, but they'll freak out less and you get a boost to crew survivability (pod impact tolerance)! And there should be another factor: notoriety (or popularity). Kerbals who have been first at something (orbit, docking, walking on the Mun) should be more popular than others, which would give any mission featuring them a boost to both Reputation gained and lost depending on the outcome.

Modders could take these different pieces and make something even more amazing, I feel.

Moving right along, I see. I hope we'll get a preview at some stage of the first-tier facilities to whet our appetites a bit. But no rush, of course; it's still early days for the next update, after all, and most of us are still digging our way through 0.25 as yet. We can wait.

Will facility upgrades be instant, or will it be built in game time, with a model of the building in a partially-built state?

Great notes BTW.
I too was hopping for a bit more info regarding kerbal experience... :-( Still, it's nice to its all shapping up nicely... :-)

Jim (Romfarer): [...]

To get a bit more technical: before the tabs were pretty much hardcoded into the part-list system and split by the Ã¢â‚¬Å“categoryÃ¢â‚¬Â field in part.cfg. We are now replacing this with an exclusion filter system that works as a combined predicate list on AvailableParts. The idea behind that change is to eventually make part-listing moddable.

Still not a single word about DOCUMENTATION, too bad !

And does anyone at Squad is aware that adding more assets (each buildings upgrade step + its demolished counterparts AND surrounding, non upgradable but still relatively upgraded stuff) will mean more memory consumption, so 64 bits will seriously NEEDS to be stable on windows or less and less mods could be use !

Features angry players will be more and more disappointed because theirs 100 indipensable mods couldn't be use all together .
I hope the building upgrade stuff extends to the island runway and the inland ksc

*nudges Harvester* Methinks it's time for another blog-post. This time about Kerbal experience - how it's supposed to look and work. Personally i think it's an awesome addition to the game, but apparently other folks are not sold on this. Moar input please

And does anyone at Squad is aware that adding more assets (each buildings upgrade step + its demolished counterparts AND surrounding, non upgradable but still relatively upgraded stuff) will mean more memory consumption, so 64 bits will seriously NEEDS to be stable on windows or less and less mods could be use !

When you boot a game not all assets are loaded at once otherwiwe youd need 20GB of RAM to play graphic intensive games.

Only the required assets to render the scene are loaded so the impact on memory usage of this new feature will hardly be noticable... :-)

*nudges Harvester* Methinks it's time for another blog-post. This time about Kerbal experience - how it's supposed to look and work. Personally i think it's an awesome addition to the game, but apparently other folks are not sold on this. Moar input please

I'm one of the guys that posted against the proposed experience plans but don't take me wrong... I love the concept, just not then implementation... But that horse was already beaten to death so I won't go there again... I'll just say that I'd also like an update regarding that.. :-) pretty please squad...

Sounds like building upgrades will just be "in-place", and so seems to preclude putting the KSC together as you like and/or in different locations on Kerbin, and/or having multiple space centers.

Still excited about having the KSC evolve as the Career does, but it could be more (well, it always can, can't it!). I hope the Dev's at least put hooks in to allow a future version of KSP to be a bit more flexible about building KSC's. Shouldn't be too difficult - each building is more or less on a big tile anyway, so should be able to select where to place them manually.

Rest of the update sounds great, looking forward to seeing the new editor/parts interface in the VAB.

Kerbal Experience could have done with a bit more news on what the current thoughts are on how that will work. Personally it would be enough if it was similar to Final Frontier keeping track of each Kerbal's achievements, without necessarily tying into the actual game mechanics.
